comment: SpO2 for Pulse Oximeter adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.OCF/master/SpO2/schema.json
description: Smart Data Models Program adaptation of the original IoTData data Models. This Resource describes the Properties associated with a person's blood oxygen saturation level.  The spo2 and perfusion Properties are read-only value that is provided by the server.  When range (from 'oic.r.baseresource') is omitted the default is 0 to +MAXFLOAT.

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform

contents.name: description
contents.comment: A description of this item

contents.name: n
contents.comment: Friendly name of the Resource

contents.name: name
contents.comment: The name of this item

contents.name: perfusion
contents.comment: This Property describes the ratio of AC over DC of PPG.

contents.name: perfusion_precision
contents.comment: When exposed the value in 'precision' provides a +/- tolerance against the Properties in the Resource. Thus if a Property is UPDATED to a value and that Property then RETRIEVED, the RETRIEVED value is valid if in the range of the set value +/- precision

contents.name: perfusion_step
contents.comment: Step value across the defined range an integer when the range is a number.  This is the increment for valid values across the range; so if range is 0.0..10.0 and step is 2.5 then valid values are 0.0,2.5,5.0,7.5,10.0.

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object

contents.name: spo2
contents.comment: This Property describes the estimation of the oxygen saturation level in percentage.

contents.name: spo2_precision
contents.comment: When exposed the value in 'precision' provides a +/- tolerance against the Properties in the Resource. Thus if a Property is UPDATED to a value and that Property then RETRIEVED, the RETRIEVED value is valid if in the range of the set value +/- precision

contents.name: spo2_step
contents.comment: Step value across the defined range an integer when the range is a number.  This is the increment for valid values across the range; so if range is 0.0..10.0 and step is 2.5 then valid values are 0.0,2.5,5.0,7.5,10.0.

contents.name: if
contents.comment: The OCF Interface set supported by this Resource.

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)

contents.name: perfusion_range
contents.comment: The valid range for the Property in the Resource as a number. The first value in the array is the minimum value, the second value in the array is the maximum value.

contents.name: rt
contents.comment: The Resource Type.

contents.name: spo2_range
contents.comment: The valid range for the Property in the Resource as a number. The first value in the array is the minimum value, the second value in the array is the maximum value.

contents.name: address
contents.comment: The mailing address
